Class MessageBuffer

java.lang.Object
br.net.dd.netherwingcore.common.utilities.MessageBuffer
public class MessageBuffer extends Object
A utility class for managing a buffer of bytes, with functionality for reading, writing, resizing, and resetting the buffer. This class is useful for handling byte streams and provides methods for efficient memory management.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MessageBuffer()
    Default constructor, initializes the buffer with a default size of 4096 bytes.

    Copy constructor.
    MessageBuffer(MessageBuffer from, boolean move)
    Movement constructor.

  • Constructor Details

    • MessageBuffer

      public MessageBuffer()
      Default constructor, initializes the buffer with a default size of 4096 bytes.

    • MessageBuffer

      public MessageBuffer(int initialSize)
      Constructor that initializes the buffer with a specified initial size.
      Parameters:
      initialSize - the initial size of the buffer.

    • MessageBuffer

      public MessageBuffer(MessageBuffer other)
      Copy constructor. Creates a new buffer that is a copy of the given buffer.
      Parameters:
      other - the buffer to copy from.

    • MessageBuffer

      public MessageBuffer(MessageBuffer from, boolean move)
      Movement constructor. Creates a new buffer by reusing the storage of the given buffer. Optionally resets the original buffer.
      Parameters:
      from - the buffer to move from.
      move - if true, the original buffer is reset.

  • Method Details

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the buffer. Clears the read and write positions, effectively making the buffer empty.

    • resize

      public void resize(int newSize)
      Resizes the buffer to the specified new size.
      Parameters:
      newSize - the new size of the buffer.

    • getBasePointer

      public byte[] getBasePointer()
      Retrieves the underlying byte array of the buffer.
      Returns:
      the storage array of the buffer.

    • getReadPointer

      public byte[] getReadPointer()
      Retrieves the portion of the buffer that is available for reading.
      Returns:
      a copy of the read portion of the buffer.

    • getWritePointer

      public byte[] getWritePointer()
      Retrieves the portion of the buffer that is available for writing.
      Returns:
      a copy of the writable portion of the buffer.

    • readCompleted

      public void readCompleted(int bytes)
      Marks a specified number of bytes as read from the buffer.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the number of bytes to mark as read.

    • writeCompleted

      public void writeCompleted(int bytes)
      Marks a specified number of bytes as written to the buffer.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the number of bytes to mark as written.

    • getActiveSize

      public int getActiveSize()
      Calculates the size of the active data in the buffer (data between the read and write positions).
      Returns:
      the active size of the buffer.

    • getRemainingSpace

      public int getRemainingSpace()
      Calculates the remaining free space in the buffer (space between the write position and the end of the buffer).
      Returns:
      the remaining free space.

    • getBufferSize

      public int getBufferSize()
      Retrieves the total capacity of the buffer.
      Returns:
      the total size of the buffer.

    • normalize

      public void normalize()
      Normalizes the buffer by moving unread data to the beginning, freeing up space for new writes. This minimizes fragmentation.

    • ensureFreeSpace

      public void ensureFreeSpace()
      Ensures that there is free space available in the buffer. If no free space remains, the buffer is resized to 1.5 times its current size.

    • write

      public void write(byte[] data)
      Writes a byte array to the buffer.
      Parameters:
      data - the data to write.

    • write

      public void write(byte[] data, int size)
      Writes a portion of a byte array to the buffer.
      Parameters:
      data - the data to write.
      size - the number of bytes to write.

    • move

      public byte[] move()
      Moves the storage to a new byte array and resets the buffer.
      Returns:
      the old storage array.

    • assign

      public MessageBuffer assign(MessageBuffer other)
      Assignment method. Copies the content of another buffer into this one.
      Parameters:
      other - the buffer to copy from.
      Returns:
      this buffer, updated with the content of the other buffer.
